moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nc3 Nf6 3. f4 exf4 4. Bc4 c6: The starting position for all the games. White is about to win back one of the two gambited Pawns.
moves.10... Bd7 11. a4: A "just in case" move, to make sure Black doesn't get any Q-side ambitions.
moves.11... a5 12. Qe2: Pinning pieces is never a bad idea.
moves.12... b6 13. c4: Trying to open up more lines.
moves.13... Be6 14. cxd5: Undoubling my Pawns after the anticipated exchange.
moves.14... Qd6 15. Bb2: Well, if Black doesn't want to recapture...
moves.15... cxd5 16. Bb5+: Ah. Black just delayed it by a move. Anyway, may as well seize this diagonal.
moves.17... Bxb5 18. Qxb5+: The clear choice. No way I'm closing the line by recapturing with the Pawn.
moves.18... Nd7 19. Nxd5: Bringing another piece into attack position.
moves.19... O-O 20. Nxe7+: I'm not about to pass on a free Bishop.
moves.20... Kh8 21. Qg5: May as well move the Q over towards Black's K.
moves.22... f5 23. Nxf5: Grabbing a loose Pawn. 23... Q-N3 was the expected reply, after which I intend to exchange Queens and win in the endgame.
moves.23... Nf6 24. Qxg7#: On the other hand, an immediate mate is fine too.
